title: Getting started
text: maintained International Classification Diseases (ICD) recording causes death since 1893. updated ICD periodically reflect new discoveries epidemiology changes medical understanding disease. CMS contracted 3M Health Information Systems 1993 design develop procedural classification system replace Volume 3 ICD-9-CM. ICD-10-PCS initially released 1998 updated annually. process constructing codes ICD-10-PCS logical consistent. Individual letters numbers, called values, selected sequence occupy seven spaces code, called characters.

title: Getting started
text: ICD-10-PCS code best understood result process rather assigned number. codes ICD-10-PCS seven characters long. character represents aspect procedure, shown following diagram characters main section ICD-10-PCS, Medical Surgical:

title: Getting started
text: One 34 possible values can assigned character code: integers 0‚Äì9 alphabet (except O, easily confused numbers 1 0). finished code looks like example . 02103D4 Bypass coronary artery, one artery coronary vein intraluminal device, percutaneous approach Choosing specific value seven characters derives code. Based details procedure performed, values character specifying section, body system, root operation, body part, approach, device, qualifier assigned. definition character function actual physical position code, value placed different position code means something totally different.
code: pcs("02103D4") #> $code #> [1] "02103D4" #>  #> $description #> [1] "Bypass Coronary Artery, One Artery from Coronary Vein with Intraluminal Device, Percutaneous Approach" #>  #> $axes #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 4 #>   axis  name        value label                       #>   <chr> <chr>       <chr> <chr>                       #> 1 1     Section     0     Medical and Surgical        #> 2 2     Body System 2     Heart and Great Vessels     #> 3 3     Operation   1     Bypass                      #> 4 4     Body Part   0     Coronary Artery, One Artery #> 5 5     Approach    3     Percutaneous                #> 6 6     Device      D     Intraluminal Device         #> 7 7     Qualifier   4     Coronary Vein               #>  #> $definitions #> # A tibble: 2 √ó 3 #>   label        definition                                            explanation #>   <chr>        <chr>                                                 <chr>       #> 1 Bypass       Altering the route of passage of the contents of a t‚Ä¶ Rerouting ‚Ä¶ #> 2 Percutaneous Entry, by puncture or minor incision, of instrumenta‚Ä¶ NA          #>  #> $includes #> # A tibble: 0 √ó 2 #> # ‚Ñπ 2 variables: label <chr>, includes <chr> pcs("0")  pcs("02")  pcs("021")  pcs("0210")  pcs("02103")  pcs("02103D")  pcs("02103D4")

title: Getting started
text: ICD-10-PCS composed 17 sections, represented numbers 0-9 letters B-D, F-H X. machinery PCS contained three parts: Index, Tables, List Codes. Additionally, Appendices contain information structure code set definitions values used code. also list guidelines ICD-10-PCS code book instruct use PCS code set.

title: Getting started
text: first section, Medical Surgical, contains majority procedures typically reported inpatient setting. Coding Example example describes excision dorsal ganglion located wrist level. PCS code built selecting appropriate characters describe intent, approach, qualifying information procedure performed. Note: purpose ICD-10-PCS code explain purpose procedure using every character describe way procedure performed. Section 0 // Medical Surgical Body System L // Tendons (Extensor tendon) Root Operation B // Excision (tendon excised removed) Body Part 5 // Lower Arm, Wrist, Right (extensor tendon located wrist level) Approach 0 // Open (incision performed blunt dissection carried layers tissue expose site) Device Z // Device Qualifier Z // Qualifier
code: __Operative Report:__ *Excision of Dorsal Ganglion, Right Wrist*  With the patient under adequate anesthesia, the right upper extremity was prepped and draped in a sterile manner. The arm was exsanguinated and the tourniquet was elevated to 290 mm/Hg. A transverse incision was made over the dorsal ganglion. Using blunt dissection the dorsal ulnar sensory nerve branches and radial sensory nerve branches were dissected and retracted out of the operative field.   The extensor tendon was then incised, dissected, and retracted out of the operative field. The ganglion was then further dissected to its origin from the dorsal distal scapholunate interosseus ligament and excised. Care was taken to protect ligament integrity. The wound was then infiltrated with 0.25% Marcaine. The tendons were allowed to resume their normal anatomical position. The skin was closed with 3-0 Prolene subcuticular stitch. Sterile dressings were applied. The tourniquet was deflated. pcs("0LB50ZX") #> $code #> [1] "0LB50ZX" #>  #> $description #> [1] "Excision of Right Lower Arm and Wrist Tendon, Open Approach, Diagnostic" #>  #> $axes #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 4 #>   axis  name        value label                             #>   <chr> <chr>       <chr> <chr>                             #> 1 1     Section     0     Medical and Surgical              #> 2 2     Body System L     Tendons                           #> 3 3     Operation   B     Excision                          #> 4 4     Body Part   5     Lower Arm and Wrist Tendon, Right #> 5 5     Approach    0     Open                              #> 6 6     Device      Z     No Device                         #> 7 7     Qualifier   X     Diagnostic                        #>  #> $definitions #> # A tibble: 2 √ó 3 #>   label    definition                                                explanation #>   <chr>    <chr>                                                     <chr>       #> 1 Excision Cutting out or off, without replacement, a portion of a ‚Ä¶ The qualif‚Ä¶ #> 2 Open     Cutting through the skin or mucous membrane and any othe‚Ä¶ NA          #>  #> $includes #> # A tibble: 0 √ó 2 #> # ‚Ñπ 2 variables: label <chr>, includes <chr>

title: Getting started
text: Sections 0-9 ICD-10-PCS comprise Medical Surgical Related sections. sections include obstetrical procedures, administration substances, measurement monitoring body functions, extracorporeal therapies, listed table . sections 0, 1, 2, seven characters define aspects procedure. Sections 3-9 differ slightly. example, sections 5 6, 5th character defined Duration instead Approach, code Intra-aortic Balloon Pump (IABP): Additional differences include uses 6th character: Section 3 defines 6th character Substance. Sections 4 - 5 define Function. Sections 7 - 9 define Method.
code: #>    value                                                 label #> 1      0                                  Medical and Surgical #> 2      1                                            Obstetrics #> 3      2                                             Placement #> 4      3                                        Administration #> 5      4                            Measurement and Monitoring #> 6      5 Extracorporeal or Systemic Assistance and Performance #> 7      6                  Extracorporeal or Systemic Therapies #> 8      7                                           Osteopathic #> 9      8                                      Other Procedures #> 10     9                                          Chiropractic pcs("5A02210") #> $code #> [1] "5A02210" #>  #> $description #> [1] "Assistance with Cardiac Output using Balloon Pump, Continuous" #>  #> $axes #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 4 #>   axis  name        value label                                                 #>   <chr> <chr>       <chr> <chr>                                                 #> 1 1     Section     5     Extracorporeal or Systemic Assistance and Performance #> 2 2     Body System A     Physiological Systems                                 #> 3 3     Operation   0     Assistance                                            #> 4 4     Body System 2     Cardiac                                               #> 5 5     Duration    2     Continuous                                            #> 6 6     Function    1     Output                                                #> 7 7     Qualifier   0     Balloon Pump                                          #>  #> $definitions #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 3 #>   label      definition                                              explanation #>   <chr>      <chr>                                                   <chr>       #> 1 Assistance Taking over a portion of a physiological function by e‚Ä¶ NA          #>  #> $includes #> NULL

previous_headings: Overview > Medical and Surgical Related Sections
title: Getting started
text: Sections B - D F - H comprise ancillary sections: definitions characters ancillary sections differ seen previous sections. Imaging section, 3rd character defined root type, 5th 6th characters define contrast contrast/qualifier respectively, CT scan example . coding CT scans, documentation must support components proper selection ICD-10-PCS code. section first character come Imaging section. body system based area examined. root type determined type imaging (CT, MRI, X-ray). body part selected determining specific body area analyzed procedure. contrast character used determine high osmolar, low osmolar, type contrast used, applicable. qualifier character used specify enhanced unenhanced images taken. Example: CT scan brain > Technique: 2.5 mm thick axial images obtained head diatrizoate (high osmolar contrast). > 0.625 mm thick axial images well coronal sagittal enhanced images also submitted interpretation. Findings: > intra- extra-axial blood fluid collection present. mass shift midline. Brain densities normal. > ventricles sulci normal size configuration. Vascular structures normal appearance. pituitary, orbits, > paranasal sinuses unremarkable. calvarium intact. Additional differences include: Section C defines 5th character Radionuclide. Section D defines 5th character Modality Qualifier 6th character Isotope. Section F defines 5th character Type Qualifier 6th character Equipment. Sections G H define 3rd character Root Type qualifier. Section X defines 7th character New Technology Group. letter changes year new technology codes added system. example, Section X codes added first year 7th character value 1, New Technology Group 1. next year contains new Section X codes 7th character value 2, New Technology Group 2, etc.
code: #>   value                                            label #> 1     B                                          Imaging #> 2     C                                 Nuclear Medicine #> 3     D                                Radiation Therapy #> 4     F Physical Rehabilitation and Diagnostic Audiology #> 5     G                                    Mental Health #> 6     H                        Substance Abuse Treatment #> 7     X                                   New Technology pcs("B02000Z") #> $code #> [1] "B02000Z" #>  #> $description #> [1] "Computerized Tomography (CT Scan) of Brain using High Osmolar Contrast, Unenhanced and Enhanced" #>  #> $axes #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 4 #>   axis  name        value label                             #>   <chr> <chr>       <chr> <chr>                             #> 1 1     Section     B     Imaging                           #> 2 2     Body System 0     Central Nervous System            #> 3 3     Type        2     Computerized Tomography (CT Scan) #> 4 4     Body Part   0     Brain                             #> 5 5     Contrast    0     High Osmolar                      #> 6 6     Qualifier   0     Unenhanced and Enhanced           #> 7 7     Qualifier   Z     None                              #>  #> $definitions #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 3 #>   label                             definition                       explanation #>   <chr>                             <chr>                            <chr>       #> 1 Computerized Tomography (CT Scan) Computer reformatted digital di‚Ä¶ NA          #>  #> $includes #> NULL

title: Getting started
text: Tables organized series, beginning section 0, medical surgical, body system 0, central nervous, proceeding numerical order. Sections 0-9 followed sections B-D F-H. convention followed within table second 7th characters ‚Äî numeric values order first, followed alphabetical values order. following examples use Medical Surgical section describe organization format ICD-10-PCS tables. Medical Surgical section (1st character 0) organized 31 body system values. body system subdivision Medical Surgical section contains introductory table lists possible values remaining characters, given body system. Tables section used construct complete valid codes. Based first three values code provided Index, corresponding table can located. tables characters arranged number, letter character. root operation tables consist four columns varying number rows, following example root operation Bypass, Central Nervous body system. Section Body System Root Operation operative report describe ventriculoperitoneal (VP) shunt placement. purpose VP shunt valve placed head, one catheter placed cerebral ventricle end peritoneal cavity. Patients require VP shunt tend diagnosed hydrocephalus, condition accumulation cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) ventricles. shunt removes accumulated fluid brain peritoneal cavity. Operative Report: VP shunt placement first incision made level frontal area, coagulation used control bleeding. , another incision made level abdominal wall, using tunneler, peritoneal catheter passed abdominal wall posterior parietal, small incision also made right frontal area. catheter primed, catheter used Bactiseal. , programmable valve set 180 mm water connected peritoneal catheter. point, using previous bur hole, Bactiseal ventricular catheter soft passed ventricle connected programmable valve. areas connection verified. , peritoneal catheter inserted peritoneal cavity, dissected layers starting rectus muscle peritoneum. catheter introduced peritoneal cavity verification dripping CSF. 00160J6 Bypass cerebral ventricle peritoneal cavity synthetic substitute, open approach reviewing description ICD-10-PCS code, notice intent procedure described root operation bypass, defined altering route passage contents tubular body part. highlighted keywords help determine proper selection code, example, procedure required incision frontal area abdominal wall able insert catheter. justify character ‚Äúopen‚Äù approach. values characters 1-3 provided top table. Four columns contain applicable values characters 4-7, given values characters 1-3. table may separated rows specify valid choices values characters 4-7. code built using values one row table valid code. table , five choices 7th character Body Part, U, Spinal Canal. can‚Äôt cross line choose 7th character row . many tables ICD-10-PCS besides tables used construct codes. appendices ICD-10-PCS code book contain many helpful tables. Appendix contains table defines root operations ICD-10-PCS code book. lists definition, also explanation example(s) root operation. root operations listed character value, numeric order, followed alphabetical order. example, Root Operations - Alteration listed Definition, Explanation, Examples face lift breast augmentation. Appendix B Body Part Key. helpful tool help match specific body part descriptor ICD-10-PCS. listed alphabetic order. Appendix C Device Key. Similar body part key, matches device descriptor ICD-10-PCS. example, Brachytherapy seeds leads Radioactive Element. Appendix D Device Aggregation Table. table crosswalks specific device character value definitions specific root operation specific body system general device character value used. example, specific device Autologous Arterial Tissue, applicable operations heart great vessels, lower arteries, lower veins, upper arteries, upper veins leads General Device 7 Autologous Tissue Substitute. Appendix E contains Character Meanings tables. gives overview codes entire system one place. following example shows introductory table Urinary system. following example shows introductory table urinary system. Table 3. Introductory table values Medical Surgical section urinary body system (characters 3-7) 0: Medical Surgical T: Urinary System Appendix F contains Substance Key. table provides substance term corresponding ICD-10-PCS Value. example, Seprafilm¬Æ ICD-10-PCS Value adhesion barrier. Appendix G contains Combination Clusters. table used codes require one ICD-10-PCS procedure code correct reporting. example provided insertion cardiac pacemaker lead coronary vein. additional procedures describe exact location lead inserted, required correct reporting. instructions Appendix specify first code cluster needs reported one additional codes listed codes considered valid. example listed , codes listed insertion cardiac resynchronization pacemaker pulse generator insertion three leads. Code many additional codes documented operative report. 02H40JZ Insertion pacemaker lead coronary vein, open approach 02H60JZ Insertion pacemaker lead right atrium, open approach 02HK0JZ Insertion pacemaker lead right ventricle, open approach 0JH607Z Insertion cardiac resynchronization pacemaker pulse generator chest subcutaneous tissue fascia, open approach Appendix H contains Non-Affecting MS-DRG Assignment codes.

title: Getting started
text: PCS codes composed seven alphanumeric characters. character contains 34 possible values. seven characters make complete code specific meanings vary 17 sections manual. value represents specific option general character definition. 10 digits (0-9) 24 letters (-H, J-N, P-Z) may used character. letters O used avoid confusion digits 0 1.

title: Getting started
text: character axis classification specifies information procedure performed. Within defined code range, character specifies type information axis classification. example, fifth axis classification specifies Approach sections 0 4 7 9 system.

title: Getting started
code: x <- pcs("0016070") x$axes |> gt(rowname_col = "axis") |> opt_table_font(font = google_font(name = "Rubik")) |> cols_align(align = "center", columns = c(axis, value)) |> tab_style(style = list(cell_fill(color = "lightgray", alpha = 0.5), cell_text(weight = "bold")), locations = cells_body(columns = value)) |> opt_all_caps() |> tab_header(title = html("ICD-10-PCS Code: ", x$code), subtitle = x$description) |> tab_footnote( footnote = html(paste0("Definition: ", delister(x$definitions[x$definitions$label == "Bypass", ])[2],". ", delister(x$definitions[x$definitions$label == "Bypass", ])[3], ".")), locations = cells_body(columns = label, rows = 3)) |> tab_footnote( footnote = html(paste("Includes:", stringr::str_flatten_comma(delister(x$includes[c("includes")]), last = ", and "))), locations = cells_body(columns = label, rows = 4)) |> tab_footnote( footnote = html(paste0("Definition: ", delister(x$definitions[x$definitions$label == "Open", ])[2], ".")), locations = cells_body(columns = label, rows = 5)) |> tab_options( table.width = pct(55), heading.title.font.size = px(20), heading.subtitle.font.size = px(14), heading.align = "left", table.font.color = "#0B0B45", footnotes.font.size = px(12)) #> Error in delister(x$definitions[x$definitions$label == "Bypass", ]): could not find function "delister"

title: Tidy ICD-10-PCS interface
text: goal procedural provide set tools working 2024 ICD-10-PCS procedure classification system.

title: Tidy ICD-10-PCS interface
text: can install procedural GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("andrewallenbruce/procedural")

title: Tidy ICD-10-PCS interface
text: ICD-10-PCS, International Classification Diseases, 10th Revision, Procedure Coding System, procedure classification system used code procedures performed hospital inpatient health care settings.
code: library(procedural)

title: Tidy ICD-10-PCS interface
code: index(search = "Achillorrhaphy") #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 6 #>      id index term           type  value           code  #>   <int> <chr> <chr>          <chr> <chr>           <chr> #> 1    38 A     Achillorrhaphy See   Repair, Tendons 0LQ

title: Tidy ICD-10-PCS interface
code: definitions(section = "0", axis = "5") |>    dplyr::select(label, definition) #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 2 #>   label                                                               definition #>   <chr>                                                               <chr>      #> 1 External                                                            Procedure‚Ä¶ #> 2 Open                                                                Cutting t‚Ä¶ #> 3 Percutaneous                                                        Entry, by‚Ä¶ #> 4 Percutaneous Endoscopic                                             Entry, by‚Ä¶ #> 5 Via Natural or Artificial Opening                                   Entry of ‚Ä¶ #> 6 Via Natural or Artificial Opening Endoscopic                        Entry of ‚Ä¶ #> 7 Via Natural or Artificial Opening With Percutaneous Endoscopic Ass‚Ä¶ Entry of ‚Ä¶ pcs("0LQV3ZZ") #> $description #> [1] "Repair Right Foot Tendon, Percutaneous Approach" #>  #> $code #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 4 #>   axis  name        value label                #>   <chr> <chr>       <chr> <chr>                #> 1 1     Section     0     Medical and Surgical #> 2 2     Body System L     Tendons              #> 3 3     Operation   Q     Repair               #> 4 4     Body Part   V     Foot Tendon, Right   #> 5 5     Approach    3     Percutaneous         #> 6 6     Device      Z     No Device            #> 7 7     Qualifier   Z     No Qualifier

Nuclear Medicine #> $description #> [1] "Planar Nuclear Medicine Imaging of Brain using Technetium 99m (Tc-99m)" #>  #> $code #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 4 #>   axis  name         value label                           #>   <chr> <chr>        <chr> <chr>                           #> 1 1     Section      C     Nuclear Medicine                #> 2 2     Body System  0     Central Nervous System          #> 3 3     Type         1     Planar Nuclear Medicine Imaging #> 4 4     Body Part    0     Brain                           #> 5 5     Radionuclide 1     Technetium 99m (Tc-99m)         #> 6 6     Qualifier    Z     None                            #> 7 7     Qualifier    Z     None pcs("DG22DZZ") # Radiation Therapy #> $description #> [1] "Stereotactic Other Photon Radiosurgery of Adrenal Glands" #>  #> $code #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 4 #>   axis  name               value label                                  #>   <chr> <chr>              <chr> <chr>                                  #> 1 1     Section            D     Radiation Therapy                      #> 2 2     Body System        G     Endocrine System                       #> 3 3     Modality           2     Stereotactic Radiosurgery              #> 4 4     Treatment Site     2     Adrenal Glands                         #> 5 5     Modality Qualifier D     Stereotactic Other Photon Radiosurgery #> 6 6     Isotope            Z     None                                   #> 7 7     Qualifier          Z     None pcs("F14Z01Z") # Physical Rehabilitation and Diagnostic Audiology #> $description #> [1] "Cochlear Implant Assessment using Audiometer" #>  #> $code #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 4 #>   axis  name                 value label                                         #>   <chr> <chr>                <chr> <chr>                                         #> 1 1     Section              F     Physical Rehabilitation and Diagnostic Audio‚Ä¶ #> 2 2     Section Qualifier    1     Diagnostic Audiology                          #> 3 3     Type                 4     Hearing Aid Assessment                        #> 4 4     Body System / Region Z     None                                          #> 5 5     Type Qualifier       0     Cochlear Implant                              #> 6 6     Equipment            1     Audiometer                                    #> 7 7     Qualifier            Z     None pcs("GZ10ZZZ") # Mental Health #> $description #> [1] "Psychological Tests, Developmental" #>  #> $code #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 4 #>   axis  name        value label               #>   <chr> <chr>       <chr> <chr>               #> 1 1     Section     G     Mental Health       #> 2 2     Body System Z     None                #> 3 3     Type        1     Psychological Tests #> 4 4     Qualifier   0     Developmental       #> 5 5     Qualifier   Z     None                #> 6 6     Qualifier   Z     None                #> 7 7     Qualifier   Z     None pcs("HZ96ZZZ") # Substance Abuse Treatment #> $description #> [1] "Pharmacotherapy for Substance Abuse Treatment, Clonidine" #>  #> $code #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 4 #>   axis  name        value label                     #>   <chr> <chr>       <chr> <chr>                     #> 1 1     Section     H     Substance Abuse Treatment #> 2 2     Body System Z     None                      #> 3 3     Type        9     Pharmacotherapy           #> 4 4     Qualifier   6     Clonidine                 #> 5 5     Qualifier   Z     None                      #> 6 6     Qualifier   Z     None                      #> 7 7     Qualifier   Z     None pcs("XY0YX37") # New Technology #> $description #> [1] "Extracorporeal Introduction of Nafamostat Anticoagulant, New Technology Group 7" #>  #> $code #> # A tibble: 7 √ó 4 #>   axis  name                            value label                    #>   <chr> <chr>                           <chr> <chr>                    #> 1 1     Section                         X     New Technology           #> 2 2     Body System                     Y     Extracorporeal           #> 3 3     Operation                       0     Introduction             #> 4 4     Body Part                       Y     Extracorporeal           #> 5 5     Approach                        X     External                 #> 6 6     Device / Substance / Technology 3     Nafamostat Anticoagulant #> 7 7     Qualifier                       7     New Technology Group 7

title: ICD-10-PCS Sections ‚Äî sections
code: sections() #>    axis    name value                                                 label #> 1     1 Section     0                                  Medical and Surgical #> 2     1 Section     1                                            Obstetrics #> 3     1 Section     2                                             Placement #> 4     1 Section     3                                        Administration #> 5     1 Section     4                            Measurement and Monitoring #> 6     1 Section     5 Extracorporeal or Systemic Assistance and Performance #> 7     1 Section     6                  Extracorporeal or Systemic Therapies #> 8     1 Section     7                                           Osteopathic #> 9     1 Section     8                                      Other Procedures #> 10    1 Section     9                                          Chiropractic #> 11    1 Section     B                                               Imaging #> 12    1 Section     C                                      Nuclear Medicine #> 13    1 Section     D                                     Radiation Therapy #> 14    1 Section     F      Physical Rehabilitation and Diagnostic Audiology #> 15    1 Section     G                                         Mental Health #> 16    1 Section     H                             Substance Abuse Treatment #> 17    1 Section     X                                        New Technology  sections("0") #>   axis    name value                label #> 1    1 Section     0 Medical and Surgical  sections("2") #>   axis    name value     label #> 1    1 Section     2 Placement  sections("X") #>   axis    name value          label #> 1    1 Section     X New Technology
